intro: Cnemidaria chiricana, commonly known as the common grasshopper plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbellate clusters. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Cnemidaria chiricana is not widely cultivated but is occasionally found in wildflower gardens due to its ornamental value.
